description: Job Advertisement: Lead UI/UX Designer - 6 Month Contract RoleAre you a creative and experienced UI/UX designer with a passion for gaming? We have an exciting opportunity for a Lead UI/UX Designer to join our dynamic team for a 6-month contract. This is your chance to contribute to cutting-edge gaming experiences that captivate players across various platforms.Role & Responsibilities:As the Lead UI/UX Designer, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the visual and interactive elements of our upcoming project. Your responsibilities will include: Collaborating with cross-functional teams to create user-centered UI/UX designs that enhance player engagement. Developing intuitive and visually striking interfaces for both PC and console platforms, with a focus on seamless cross-play experiences. Utilizing your mobile shooter game expertise to bring innovative mobile interface designs to life. Leading the UI/UX design process from concept to implementation, ensuring a consistent and cohesive player experience. Translating AAA game standards into user interfaces that meet the high expectations of our players. Leveraging your PC/Console to mobile porting experience to adapt and optimize UI elements for mobile platforms. Conducting user research and analyzing player feedback to iterate and refine UI/UX designs for optimal usability.Skills & Qualifications:To succeed in this role, you should have: Extensive UI/UX design experience, ideally within the gaming industry. Proven expertise in designing for both PC and console platforms, with a deep understanding of their unique requirements. A strong portfolio showcasing your ability to create visually appealing and user-friendly interfaces. Experience in mobile shooter game design, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable gaming experience on mobile devices. Familiarity with cross-play mechanics and challenges, enabling you to design interfaces that facilitate smooth cross-platform interactions. Prior involvement in AAA or triple A game projects, demonstrating your ability to meet and exceed industry standards. A track record of successful UI/UX design for porting PC/Console games to mobile platforms.If you are a passionate UI/UX designer with a flair for creating exceptional gaming experiences, we want to hear from you! Join us in shaping the future of gaming interfaces.For more information, please contact: Phone: +46108885279 Email: t.moon@nigelfrank.com

Are you an ambitious Front-End Developer with a passion for building stunning user interfaces and interactive web applications using the latest web technologies? Do you have a deep understanding of React, JavaScript, and TypeScript? If you thrive in a creative and collaborative environment and are eager to contribute to cutting-edge projects, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Front-End Developer!Responsibilities Collaborate with the design and back-end development teams to implement and refine user interfaces with React, JavaScript, and TypeScript. Build reusable and modular components, ensuring the best performance and user experience. Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability while maintaining a pixel-perfect user interface. Participate in code reviews, share knowledge, and provide constructive feedback to team members. Stay up-to-date with the latest front-end trends, techniques, and technologies, and advocate for their adoption when appropriate. Troubleshoot and debug complex issues to ensure the highest level of application stability and performance. Strong knowledge of JavaScript and TypeScript, with the ability to write clean, maintainable, and testable code. Familiarity with state management libraries like Redux or MobX. Experience with RESTful APIs and asynchronous programming. Understanding of modern front-end build tools and package managers, such as Webpack, Babel, and npm. Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment and adapt quickly to changing requirements. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. A portfolio showcasing previous React and TypeScript projects is highly advantageous.Preferred Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Web Development, or a related field. Familiarity with UI/UX design principles and the ability to collaborate effectively with designers. Knowledge of testing frameworks such as Jest, Enzyme, or Testing Library. Experience with server-side rendering and Next.js. AI for People defines what Silo AI stands for. We want to build a world with safe human-centric AI that frees the human mind from manual labour and empowers human creativity. We are looking experienced software developers interested in implementing production-grade AI solutions.As a Full Stack Software Developer you will be working on creating solutions and products for our clients. You will e.g. design and develop secure, and reliable web-based UI's and backend services for Machine Learning solutions. You will design and implement tools and applications that change the way we build and run our AI solutions and how we fit them into broader software systems. You will take care of packaging, testing, deploying, and supporting the software you deliver.Our current tech stack and tools consist of for example Python, Vue.js, React, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Jenkins, and Kubernetes across private and public clouds Azure, AWS, and GCP. Read more about our cases that we have made for Infranode in automated lead generation and Philips in radiotherapy planning.What we valueStrong experience with our key technologies, including Python and preferably Vue.jsExperience in designing and building cloud-deployed web-based applications and data-heavy backend servicesInitiative, pragmatic problem solving, and great communication skillsDesire and ability to quickly acquire broad high-level intuition of AI systems and solutionsExperience in devops, AI systems and frameworks, scientific Python stack, edge deployments, and infrastructure automation is a big plusWhat Silo offers for you?As we already know, AI will be affecting almost everyone's work and everyday life. With us you have a real chance of shaping the change that AI will bring to everyone of us. You will get to choose your tools, methods, and ways of working together with the team while ramping it up. The products you develop will have a key role in expanding and accelerating the use of AI in large scale real world applications. Your closest colleagues will be an AI enthusiast mix of model developers and software experts working in the AI areas of computer vision, machine learning, and natural language processing. We aim for excellence by keep learning from the market, sharing our competence and looking for a growth mindset. We will help your learning for example through our Learning Labs and Talent CoachingInterested in joining us?Send your application and tell us why you are interested in the Software Developer role at Silo AI and what you are passionate about, along with relevant profiles (CV/LinkedIn/Github).

job-title: Multiple Software Developer Positions available across Finland

Our finance start-up company is seeking talented and motivated developers to join our team. job-title: Web Developer, Backend Developer  & Test Automation Engineer roles, Finland
description: On behalf of our client in Finland, who has many ongoing - and starting projects in several cities, we are looking to find the right talent to following fulltime roles : Web Developer, Test Automation Engineer, and Backend Developer.Your future colleagues are waiting you to join our international team.We are working in the really modern and comfortable offices aroundFinland (The position can be in Helsinki,Tampere, Oulu or in Turku).Working with us is uncomplicated and easy due to our goodteam spirit, low-hierarchy and nonexistent bureaucracy. Our way ofworking is flexible, and you are allowed to work also remotely as longas you are able to visit our office time to time when needed. We hopeyou are able to start as soon as possible, but we are ready tonegotiate it.Available positions: Web DeveloperLocation: Tampere, Helsinki, Turku & OuluLanguage skills: Finnish requiredRequirements:React, Node, Java, C#min. 5 + years of experience Test Automation SpecialistLocation: Tampere, Helsinki, Turku & Oulu.Language: English okRequirements:5 years or more work experience in quality assurance and one or more testing software Solid skills with multiple test automation related frameworks/tools/libraries (such as Robot Framework, Jenkins, Selenium, Jira, JUnit, Docker etc.) Ability to script with at least one programming language Experience in agile environment (e.g. DevOps, Scrum) Work experience of testing embedded devices and/or web services Understanding of various test processes, types and methodsBackend DeveloperLocation: Tampere, Helsinki, Turku & Oulu.Language skills: English okRequirements: React, Python, REST, PostgreSQLNice to have - skills:Material UI, FastAPI, Kafkamin. 5 + years of experience About the company:A modern software company that develops state-of-the-art technology solutions for the automotive, telecommunications and industry sectors. Creating success by rewriting the Finnish software development success story in a completely new way. The operations revolve around people to support well-being and development – not forgetting exceptional results to our customers.Interested? Recruitment is handled by iHeadHunt and you can contact Marle Kettunen on +358 503361636 or mk@iheadhunt.dk if you want to know more about the role. Applications are continuously assessed, so please apply as fast as possible!

In Qt, we work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving. We are passionate about our products and solutions, and we live for our customers. We have high expectations and a career at Qt means challenging yourself to always be better.The sales activity for our main product Qt and associated Consulting Services is growing fast in our major territories and The Qt Company has a solid customer base, containing a large number of internationally well-branded companies. Our customers use our tools for highly valued developments of applications in different areas such as EDA, Medical, consulting, Telecommunications, and Automotive, among others. The EMEA market is among the most important regions for Qt and provides an excellent opportunity for a skilled and experienced sales professional to take responsibility for developing the Qt business in markets with strong potential. The Sales Engineer is responsible for pre-sales technical assistance for the regional sales teams and will perform technical presentations & demonstrations of the Qt product line, in addition, be involved in all aspects of the technical sales.ResponsibilitiesDirectly responsible for teaming with the sales team through all aspects of the sales cycle.Understand technical customer requirements and find solutions together with Product Management / R&D.Provide strategic and senior-level product presentations, demonstrations, and trade show support.Follow up on prospects and accounts for functional/technical issues related to the sales cycle and guarantee a successful customer experience.Manage product evaluations and prepare RFP/RFI responses.Coordinate the technical training of the sales teams.Identify the need for additional sales, training, and consulting.ExperienceTechnical knowledge and understanding of the development processes5+ years of experience in technical selling, embedded technology, or similarSolid understanding and experience with C/C++ and preferably other object-oriented languagesQt knowledge is a clear advantage.Knowledge of a low-level software stackExcellent presentation, demonstration, and facilitation skills in leading meetings, trials, and projectsExperience with the creation, customization, and delivery of presentationsFluent verbal and written communication in EnglishBachelor’s degree in computer science/ technology or equivalent related experienceSkillsAutonomous and organized with effective communication skills, listening, verbal, and written.Must take initiative and be a proactive member of the sales team.Team player with interpersonal skills to work with sales and technical staff in a dynamic and innovative company environment.Very good business understanding.Willing and able to travel 20% within EMEAThe role is based in one of our offices in Europe; Espoo, Finland; Oslo, Norway; Paris, France or Munich/Berlin/Hamburg, Germany.What We OfferAt Qt, you get to work with a truly global team in an innovative and fun environment and with world-leading customers and a large, unique community. We have a cool product, but it is our people that make us exceptionalEasy-going atmosphere with talented and great colleagues from many parts of the worldChances to learn new every dayNice office space and ergonomic equipmentFull support for your mental health at work and at home via Auntie Program Flexible and remote-friendly policy Language learning platform Diverse teams from different cultures promote creativity and inclusivity. Mobile Phone Plus local benefitsAbout QtQt Group (Nasdaq Helsinki: QTCOM) is a global software company, trusted by industry leaders and over 1.5 million developers worldwide to create applications and smart devices that users love. We help our customers to increase productivity through the entire product development lifecycle - from UI design and software development to quality management and deployment.Our customers are in more than 70 different industries in over 180 countries. Qt Group is headquartered in Espoo, Finland, and employs almost 700 people globally. To learn more, visit www.qt.ioBe yourself at QtAt Qt, we appreciate the individual differences of our employees and aim to promote diversity through all our practices. We provide a workplace that generates equal opportunities regardless of gender, religion, national origin, age, disabilities, and any other factors. We have unique products, but our people make us exceptional. We strongly encourage people from all groups to apply – we welcome you as you are.

This role is available through Jefferson Frank, an international agency that has grown to be one of the trusted recruitment partners to businesses across Finland in different industries and domains. To learn more about this opportunity, reach out to George Paxton on LinkedIn who is responsible for this advert.Company DetailsSkills & expertise shortages with start-ups & SME's is a common issue that the majority of Entrepreneur's will experience at some point along the way of setting up their business, in a world of everyone being a specialist in something, even with the luxury of capital investment, hiring more expertise is not always the logical solution.This SaaS client based in Helsinki looks to solve one of these issues when it comes to financial invoicing for small and growing enterprises within Europe. Their goal is to be a pioneer within invoicing services whose open and innovative approach means Entrepreneur's can continue to grow their business with confidence that their finances are taken care of, taking care of all paperwork and employer payments.The RoleDespite being immersed in a key growth in the company's history, they already have a mature & well structured setup with 16+ members inthe team that include a Tech Lead, Fullstack + Backend developers and a UI/UX professional with the ambition of adding multiple heads before the end of 2023.With the product growing in popularity, you'd be in a classic product development role, primarily focused on the backend. They already have a scalable system written with Node, TypeScript & Angular. The chosen candidate's primarily responsibility will be to write RestAPI's from scratch and integrate solutions into customers environments in addition to multiple book-keeping softwares.You'll be working cross-functionally not only with tech professionals but also marketing to ensure the customer experience is as efficient as possible in addition to personally promoting the product. Furthermore, you'll be working across the full development lifecycle from understanding requirements, building solutions and deployments to the mature architecture.What they're looking for? 5+ years Fullstack experience working with frameworks including Node, TypeScript & Angular. Firebase experience.Beneficial If You Have Experience from past product development roles. Finnish speaking.Next StepsIf you're looking to join an ambitious & growing product development setup within a hot industry, this could be for you. They already have plans in place to expand to other European countries including Sweden, Germany and the UK whilst maintaining their open team with a close-knit feel.If you're considering taking that next step for this opportunity or simply want to learn more about this company or others that Jefferson Frank is actively working in Finland. Submit your CV via this job portal or reach out to George Paxton on LinkedIn.

company: Target Vision Oy - Executive Search & Recruitment Tailor Made Solutions in Finland and International
description: Do you want to work on cutting-edge technology that will shape the future of the maritime industry? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!We are looking for a Senior 3D Software Engineer to join our team and help us migrate our proprietary visual engine to Unreal Engine. You will be the main point of contact for technical challenges, and you will partner with teams across the globe to provide the best experiences for our customers. You will also mentor and foster the professional development of a small team, while also being a significant individual contributor.As a Senior 3D Software Engineer, you will:Establish and maintain a shared development stream for migration and usage of Unreal Engine. You will be responsible for setting up the project structure, configuration, and version control. You will also ensure that the code is consistent, clean, and well-documented.Investigate upcoming engine features and provide guidance on how best to use them. You will be always on the lookout for new and improved ways of creating stunning visuals and realistic physics. You will also share your findings and recommendations with the rest of the team.Establish a shared Unreal Engine knowledge base. You will create and maintain a repository of tips, tricks, tutorials, and best practices for using Unreal Engine in marine simulation. You will also answer questions and provide feedback to other developers.Develop engine plugins to solve common developer workflow issues. You will identify and implement solutions for common problems that arise during development, such as asset import, level editing, debugging, and optimization.Provide guidance on project configuration/structure. You will help define and enforce the standards and conventions for organizing the project files, folders, assets, and scripts. You will also ensure that the project is compatible with different platforms and devices.Support of existing visual engine solution. You will also provide support for the existing visual engine solution, which is based on our proprietary technology. You will help fix bugs, improve performance, and add new features as needed.To be successful in this role, you should have:4+ years of Unreal Engine experience. You should be proficient in using Unreal Engine for creating 3D simulations, especially in terms of graphics, physics, UI, and data integration. You should also be familiar with the latest features and updates of the engine.Excellent C++ architecture, programming, and optimization skills. You should be able to write high-quality C++ code that follows the best practices and standards. You should also be able to optimize your code for speed, memory, and performance.Proficient in any source control, debuggers, profilers, and other software development tools (Git, Visual Studio, Unreal Insights, and RenderDoc). You should be able to use these tools effectively to manage your code, find and fix errors, measure and improve performance, and create stunning visuals.Good knowledge in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent education or experience. You should have a solid foundation in computer science and engineering concepts, such as algorithms, data structures, design patterns, OOP, etc.Team leading and problem-solving skills. You should be able to lead a small team of developers by setting goals, assigning tasks, providing feedback, and resolving conflicts. You should also be able to solve complex technical problems creatively and efficiently.It would be a plus if you also have:Understanding of build systems, continuous integration, unit tests, automated functional tests, and testing frameworks. You should be able to use these tools to automate the building, testing, and deployment of your project. You should also be able to write tests that ensure the quality and functionality of your code.Practical knowledge of DX12 API. You should be able to use DX12 API to access low-level graphics features and optimize your rendering pipeline.The duration of the project is initially 6 months, with a possibility of continuation. The location is either Finland or Serbia. Fluent written and spoken English is mandatory. The allocation is 100%.If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply by sending your CV and portfolio.

Drive the future of collaborative open source development tooling as part of the Launchpad team. This is an opportunity for a motivated engineer with a passion for open source software, Linux, and web services to join our distributed team.Launchpad is a platform for managing open source development projects. It includes code hosting and review, bug tracking, package building, translations, and other facilities used by free and open source software developers. It provides essential development and collaboration infrastructure for major projects such as Ubuntu.Launchpad is a mature project, mainly written in Python (primarily Zope, with some Flask). You'll be striking a balance between keeping our business-critical services running and expanding our feature set: among other things, we are currently working on expanding our package building capabilities, improving the development flows provided to our users, and modernising our web UI. If you love keeping large projects well-organised and well-maintained, care about supporting developers, and believe that continuous improvement is the key to innovation, higher velocity, and reliability, you'll fit right in.Build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.What You'll DoProactively collaborate within and contribute to design, architecture, and feature-selection for solutions across distributed teamsWrite high-quality, API-first Python code with unit testsDebug issues and produce high-quality fixesReview code produced by other engineersWork from home with global travel 2 to 4 times a year for internal and external eventsWho You AreYou love technology, working with brilliant people, and solving interesting problemsYou are a strategic thinkerYou are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountableYou value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivatedYou have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degreeYou have proficiency delivering robust code to production, preferably written in Python. You have experience and enjoy maintaining and improving large and mature web applications. You have experience with databases, ORMs (PostgreSQL a plus), data management, and data modelling. You have an interest in, or experience with, integration, infrastructure and operations. You believe that robust security requires conscious efforts at every stage of delivery. You have familiarity with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform. You have a solid understanding of the structure of various software packaging systems, including Debian/Ubuntu packages. Canonical is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We truly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu.#stack
